summary: Graduate of European Studies and Economics, with experience in working as a specialist/expert for local, government and international administration. Polish delegate to the most important alliances of youth organizations (YFJ, IYDU). Author of so far the best housing program "Mieszkanie dla Młodych" in Poland, main lobbyist of the European Pillar of Social Rights. I also gained experience working for international investment bank (Citi), consulting (EY) as well as in tourism (LOT Polish Airlines) and the hotel industry (IHG). I'm fluent in Polish, English and Italian as well as communicatively in German and Dutch.

projects.title: Polish Israeli German Congress "Polis" 18' 19' 20' 21' 22'
projects.description: Congress is an annual, two-day event regarding Polish-Israeli and Polish-German relations, based on a political and business approach. The conference expands its thematic scope by including some aspects of multilateral discussions. Through a holistic analysis of current political and economic events, organizers want to bring the audience closer to possible ways of developing mutual relations now and in the future. Furthermore, the congress aims to present Poland as a country of great opportunities, friendly to innovation and creating the right environment for doing business.

Focused on creating political ideas and monitoring the situation of freedom of expression and the development of democracy.

The aim of the Conference at University of Warsaw was to diagnose the current scientific relations German-Polish and prospects of their development
in levels: political, economic, social and cultural, both bilaterally as
and European.

projects.title: Quality jobs for young people
projects.description:
Two panel discussions centered on how the Investment Plan can be used to create quality jobs for youth, and what such quality jobs entail – with participants proposing various solutions, including:

Investment in youth: The EU Investment Plan must prioritise investment in sectors that are job-rich and have potential to create quality jobs for young people. If projects for investments are carefully selected 2.1 million new jobs could be created by 2018[1].
An end to the “any-job-will-do” approach - jobs should allow young people to live a life in dignity and to become autonomous – precarious working conditions should be eliminated.
Social issues related to employment and social protection should be more effectively addressed – young people’s access to social benefits must be non-discriminatory; measures that address poverty and social exclusion among young people, with full involvement of trade unions and youth organisations in reaching out to those that are the hardest-to-reach.
Labour mobility – portability of social rights should be ensured. Migration must be on a voluntary basis.
Entrepreneurship – support should be given to young people that want to start their own business with measures to facilitate access to credit and ensure social security for young entrepreneurs.

projects.title: Eastern Partnership Youth Forum
projects.description: 2nd Eastern Partnership Youth Forum was attended by about 200 young people, youth workers , researchers and policy makers from both the Eastern Partnership and the Erasmus Programme + countries. The forum aims to exchange innovative ideas and explore how different mobility programs and partnerships , cross-sectoral cooperation and work with policy makers can improve employment opportunities and youth employment . The Forum was organized in the framework of the Latvian Presidency of the European Union

projects.title: Youth Shaping the Future of Europe - 25 Years of German-Polish Experience
projects.description: On the occasion of the 25th anniversary of the signing of the Treaty on Good Neighbourhood and Mutual and the 25th anniversary of the Polish-German Youth Cooperation PROM and DBJR prepared a seminar for youth in Berlin, the aim of which was to exchange experiences and perspectives on youth and youth policy in Poland and in Germany. As youngsters from large neighboring European countries want to take part in shaping the future of our countries and the continent, especially in the face of radicalization and euroscepticism. We focused on three themes: Migration, mobility and participation.

projects.title: Youth Power
projects.description:
The aim is to mobilize young people and the development of the action potential of youth councils by strengthening networks of local youth at the national level. We analyze the local communities of participants and problems occurring in them - know the differences between the municipalities and their impact on the mode of action and talk about how to work with politicians and local authorities. Learn to lead konultacje within a structured dialogue in the European Union 

Subsequent meetings will concern debating - because it will play a significant role in the design and implementation of election promises forcing local politicians. We'll find out also what is a structured dialogue in the European Union, and learn to consult its framework. We will attend the above-mentioned EU Youth Conference in the country holding the EU Presidencies. There will be six multi-day meetings throughout the Polish.

projects.title: OECD Experts Group on Social Inclusion
projects.description: The expert group of the European youth organizations working on a report on social inclusion in the European Union for the organization of the OECD in Paris. We analyze the situation of young people, we promote beneficial solutions and lobbying for new European laws.

Young people's values and commitments to intercultural and inclusive societies.

projects.title: Task force on validation of non-formal and informal learning
projects.description: The validation of non-formal and informal learning outcomes is a key issue for EUCIS-LLL and European Youth forum. Coherence in lifelong learning strategies means building bridges between formal, non-formal and informal education. This focus on flexible learning pathways has led in the past years to an increased attention paid to the validation and recognition of learning that takes place outside formal systems.

projects.title: 24th Economic Forum Krynica-Zdrój
projects.description:
The Economic Forum in Krynica – Zdroj is the largest conference in Central and Eastern Europe.

Every year the Forum, organized at the beginning of September brings more than 2,500 guests. These are political, economic and social leaders as well as approx. 500 journalists. The guests come from over 60 countries in Europe, Asia and America. The Economic Forum, by its concept, is open to various ways of thinking about state and economy. In Krynica people come together not only to present their offers and seek opportunities for cooperation, but also to participate in the first class debates class of business theorists and practitioners. Personal contacts are a great introduction to an agreement on issues that are of great importance.

projects.title: Debate of candidates for the European Parliament
projects.description: Organizer: The Debate of candidates for the European Parliament from the region of Silesia. Organized in the framework of a pan-European project "League of Young Voters." The debate was held on May 15 in the Session Hall of the City Hall of Częstochowa.

profile_positions.description:
My current position gives me comprehensive development in the field of hospitality on the Dutch market. Thanks to the development program of one of the world's largest hotel groups - IHG, I have the opportunity to work in the best hotels in Netherlands. My main duties include: 
- Supporting, training, and supervising front office staff.
- Ensuring that all customer-related tasks are handled accurately and on time to improve guests' experience.
- Handling customer complaints and special requests.
- Scheduling staff shifts and managing other HR-related tasks.
- Maintaining an orderly appearance throughout the reception area.
- Monitoring stock and ordering office supplies, including stationery and information leaflets.
- Preparing monthly management reports on customer feedback, bookings, and cancellations.
- Managing the departmental budget.
- Updating files and records.
- Enforcing all cash-handling, checking, and credit procedures.
profile_positions.title: Front Office Manager

profile_positions.description:
The Field Deployment Unit (FDU) responds to risks, threats or vulnerabilities identified by the Situational Awareness and Monitoring Division or raised by Member States and third countries at sea, land or air external borders. The Unit implements Frontex’s strategy in field operations.

The FDU plans, conducts, monitors and evaluates field deployments by implementing operational activities at the external borders of Member States and on the territory of third countries, and provides an appropriate response to specific threats or vulnerabilities in line with European standards and fundamental rights.
profile_positions.title: Administration Assistant

profile_positions.description:
- preparation and development of general solutions for statistics for a representative of Poland for meetings of the Council of the European Union,
- organizing the participation of representatives of the Statistics Poland in meetings of the Council Working Group on Statistics in order to ensure continuity and efficiency of its work,
- preparation of travel instructions and reports on trips to the above mentioned meetings,
- participation in the work related to the circulation of documents regarding the cooperation of the Statistics Poland with the EU institutions, the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and the Permanent Representation of the Republic of Poland to the EU in order to ensure the correct timeliness and circulation of documents, 
- placing information and documents on public folders of the Statistics Poland related to the work of the institutions of the European Union to ensure the circulation of information beetwen central headquarters and local branches,  
-  implementing new EU legal acts into the Polish legal order and entering them into the appropriate system coordinated by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs in order to ensure the correct implementation of EU legal acts into the national legal order.

profile_positions.description:
I run a pro-turnout project regarding the elections to the European Parliament in 2019. It covers the promotion of knowledge about the European Union and the possibility of voting throughout Poland in nearly 100 places. Where meetings and primaries are held, coordinated and carried out with the officials of the Parliament and the European Commission. 
Thanks to our work, the turnout reached a historical record: 45.61% and will be also continued after the election.

profile_positions.title: Junior Growing Specialist

profile_positions.description:
The European Youth Forum (Youth Forum Jeunesse - YFJ) is the biggest representation platform for Youth Organizations in Europe and world. It represents the voices of National Youth Councils (NYCs) and International Non Governmental Youth Organizations (INGYOs) catering for their needs and defending young people's rights towards the European Union, the Council of Europe and the United Nations. We believe youth organisations are the tool through which we empower, encourage, involve, represent, reach out and support young people. The Youth Forum brings together tens of millions of young people from all over Europe, organised in order to represent their common interests.  
 
youthforum.org 
 
Tasks: Inside the organization I was a specialist in the field of economic and social. It deals with working groups relating to "Quality Job for Young People"​, "Mobility Group"​ and "Task Force on Validation of Non-formal education". We were responding to current issues and problems of young people in all countries of the European Union.  
With success I worked with the European Commission on the project of European Pillar of Social Rights and in working group "Future of Work and Social Inclusion".

volunteer_experiences.description: JEF Poland - Młodzi Europejscy Federaliści is a federation of autonomous federalist sections situated in cities throughout Poland. Operating in English and Polish, JEF Poland has established a strong pro-European movement with which the Polish youth identify with and support. The current capacity of the organisation includes, but is not limited to: debates, formal conversations, media relations and availability of publication in journals, petitioning, international event collaboration and social gatherings.

Our group dealt with global exchange of volunteers "Next Step", we maintain contacts with schools interested in intercultural activities, and we are in contact with the national authorities on the accommodation of foreigners. I also co-organized the largest and oldest job fair for young people in Poland "Dni Kariery".
